result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian D Burbey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 09/01/2015 and each month thereafter or penalty of 9 days jail for non-payment.  Defendant may perform Community Service at the rate of $10.00/hr in lieu of payment of fine. Proof of completion must be filed with the court prior to due date.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian D Burbey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brian D Burbey in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant wishes to accept the States offer.  Defendant waives his right to counsel.  Court performs colloquy with defendant regarding his right to an attorney.  Defendnat wishes to proceed pro se' and enters a no contest plea to count #1.  Court performs colloquy with defendant and finds him guilty of count #1.  State gives recommendations.  Defendant makes statements. Court gives oral sentencing.  


The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1
FINE: $ 442.00
 (To be paid at the rate of $50.00  per month commencing 9/1/2015  Failure to pay or complete community service the Court orders 9 days Huber as contempt for non-compliance with Court Order).
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brian D Burbey in court.  Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears pro se.  Court advises Defendant of his right to counsel.  Defendant states he wishes to seek counsel.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Brian D Burbey in court.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advises of right to an attorney. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.
